cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north then turning north-northeast toward the southwest Louisiana coast, then inland across Louisiana and the Lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of Cameron, LA (south-central Louisiana coast)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – east of Morgan City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas; Storm Surge Warning – High Island, TX to the Mouth of the Pearl River, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward across all of Louisiana into coastal Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (40–50 mph with higher gusts) likely Friday afternoon through early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft possible from Port Fourchon to the Mouth of the Mississippi River; 1–3 ft into Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas around the New Orleans area
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher totals could produce flash and urban flooding in the New Orleans metro
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands and dangerous rip currents along area beaches
